record.dc:title: 151BY13/152BY13 [2x exposure] Ledford Island, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burials 16BY86 and 87. Square 5R3. Direction SE.
record.wpa:narrative: [16BY86] Adult female in good condition, extended on back with head to west. Pit from plowzone filled with mixed clay and humus. Considerable burned bark and wood mixed in pit fill. Pit of 16BY87 was connected with 16BY86 at top just below plowline, forming one large pit about 7' square. About 10' below plowzone, pit divided into two separate parts, depth of pits may have necessitated considerable breadth at top, thus running pits together. Bones resting on subsoil. Head about 0.1' higher than feet. Mouth open. Right arm partly under pelvis. Knees together. Feet slightly apart. Little or no posthumous shifting of bones. [16BY87] Adult male in good condition, extended on back with head to west. Pit was same at top as 16BY86, divided below in to two pits. Bones lay on subsoil. Skull about 0.2' higher than feet. Face slightly to left, mouth open. Left arm partly under pelvis. Knees slightly apart, feet together. Left tibia posthumously rolled slightly to left. It cannot be definitely said that these are simultaneous, but pits ran together at top. Pits had two large postholes between them. This may well be a case of pits accidentally touching. Pit more rectangular just above bones.
